meanings.definition: The quality or state of being whiny.
meanings.sent1: Her constant whininess about the weather was starting to annoy everyone.
meanings.sent2: I can't stand the whininess of that child whenever he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: Despite her whininess, she always managed to make us laugh with her silly complaints.
meanings.sent4: The whininess in the room was so loud, it felt like a swarm of bees buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The whininess of the broken record player was a constant reminder of its malfunction.

meanings.definition: The act of complaining in a high-pitched or irritating manner.
meanings.sent1: His whininess about the long lines at the store was getting on everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent2: The whininess in her voice made it hard to take her complaints seriously.
meanings.sent3: Despite his whininess, his friends always found a way to cheer him up.
meanings.sent4: The whininess of the squeaky door was like a constant reminder of its need for oil.
meanings.sent5: The whininess of the alarm clock in the morning was enough to make anyone want to stay in bed.
